channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Researchers say no evidence of TikTok censorship, but they remain wary
item.description: Posts have been going viral on social media accusing TikTok's new owners of suppressing content, but eight academics examined the issue and found no evidence to support the claims.
item.content:encoded:
Posts have been going viral on social media accusing TikTok's new owners of suppressing content, but eight academics examined the issue and found no evidence to support the claims.

(Image credit: Riccardo Milani)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Newly released court records reveal misconduct inquiry into federal judge
item.description: A federal judge said he retired to speak out about threats to the rule of law. Newly released court orders suggest his exit coincided with a misconduct inquiry that ended when he stepped down.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge said he retired to speak out about threats to the rule of law. Newly released court orders suggest his exit coincided with a misconduct inquiry that ended when he stepped down.

(Image credit: Ricky Carioti/The Washington Post via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Moltbook is the newest social media platform — but it's just for AI bots
item.description: A new message board for artificial intelligence agents has prompted some strange conversations, and existential questions about the inner lives of bots.
item.content:encoded:
A new message board for artificial intelligence agents has prompted some strange conversations, and existential questions about the inner lives of bots.

(Image credit: Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: The Supreme Court lets California use its new, Democratic-friendly congressional map
item.description: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for California to use its new congressional map for this year's midterm election. Voters approved it as a Democratic counterresponse to Texas' new GOP-friendly map.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court has cleared the way for California to use its new congressional map for this year's midterm election. Voters approved it as a Democratic counterresponse to Texas' new GOP-friendly map.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Reporter's notebook: A peek inside the Olympic Village
item.description: NPR reporters visited the Milan Olympic Village in the days before the opening ceremony to investigate the dining hall dessert situation and other pressing questions.
item.content:encoded:
NPR reporters visited the Milan Olympic Village in the days before the opening ceremony to investigate the dining hall dessert situation and other pressing questions.

(Image credit: Rachel Treisman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Search for Nancy Guthrie, mother of 'Today' show host Savannah Guthrie, enters 4th day
item.description: Police in Arizona believe Nancy Guthrie, 84, was taken by force from her Tucson area home this weekend. So far, no suspect or person of interest has been identified.
item.content:encoded:
Police in Arizona believe Nancy Guthrie, 84, was taken by force from her Tucson area home this weekend. So far, no suspect or person of interest has been identified.

(Image credit: Sejal Govindarao)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where candles are the last option during wartime blackouts
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Bezos orders deep job cuts at 'Washington Post'
item.description: The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security.

(Image credit: Nicholas Kamm)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Photos: Scenes from the 150th Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Hundreds of dogs competed for the top prize at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show this week. Penny the Doberman pinscher was named best in show.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of dogs competed for the top prize at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show this week. Penny the Doberman pinscher was named best in show.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Emily Bogle

item.title: How a Black fossil digger became a superstar in the very white world of paleontology
item.description: In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.
item.content:encoded:
In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
